for purchase of used cars  is it the standard to pay deposit then send to my own workshop for inspection. possible to send to workshop first? i dont mind paying some cash to cover their logistics.
Have to place deposit first 😊.
can write down in black and white  if engine/gearbox problem you reserve the right to cancel and get a refund for your deposit. If have wear and tear repairs needed  seller and buyer to split 50:50
If they don't agree just walk
High chance selling you a lemon

i just thought their terms of "A full deposit refund will be done in an event if the vehicle is found to have engine/gearbox/chassis damage" a little too vague. and i dont really know how to check before even paying the deposit haha 🥲
At the rate u r going  U r better off buying a new car
🥺🥺🥺 but i get what u mean
Ignore him. He’s a weirdo. Just take ur time to investigate

Deposit don’t pay. Once u pay Liao  u r arguing from a  disadvantage. Basically it’s v hard to prove engine or gearbox problem. It becomes ur duty to open it up n show them exactly where n why is it considered spoilt. Btw oil leaking   shaking or weird noise does not mean spoilt - just observations.
Dealers mostly are good at twisting to their own advantage
Buyers will always lose to sellers
So what do you suggest to be the agreement when buying from second hand dealers? I also read engine and gear box problems will be difficult to find and prove.
Research n buy tools to do ur own inspection. The experience n tools will be v beneficial in future.
Okay. What kind of tools are available to test the engine and gearbox. I believe these two are the most expensive parts to service if they are a problem

Universal obd2 scanner. Inspection mirror sets. Endoscope. Stethoscope. Smoke leak tester. Magnet detector. Portable jack. Most impt is research to gain experience. Make a checklist of all parts needed to inspect. Another checklist for test drive. Take pics n send to ai to inspect.
Thanks this seems to be a heavy undertaking though 😂. Some dealers offer 1year warranty on engine and gearbox. For a few extra dollars this would be a safer deal right.
I heard stories of dealers delaying repair until warranty expire
Da fck. These guys.. Seriously 😒
Next time buy 2nd hand  bring Pete along w you
Confirm get a used brand new car
Can start first with the obd2 scanner. It’s the easiest. Cold start check for error codes. Warm up n check. Whack the car n check for codes again.
Yeah I also thought OBD2 seems the easiest one of the lot. And a long term investment for maintaining a car.
Get a good obd2 scanner. Can plot n analyse graphs of all the impt sensors. Check if it’s within normal range

The mechanic won’t do until so detailed. They got many cars to settle. I bet they can’t tell u what should be the normal range of the sensors. The brake mechanic don’t even know what is the correct torque for tightening my wheel nuts. If u don’t tell them  they just use impact gun to tighten to the max. Next time u will cry if nut break n get stuck in the wheel when trying to unbolt

These mechanics r usually lowly educated bengs who donno n can’t be bothered with official range of values of impt components n sensors n importance of using correct torque on bolts. They will say “kid  I been repairing cars for 20 years”
Big names not necessarily means reliable e.g. cartimes
Talk ez. Most of the time  the best deal is not from reputable places. On the contrary  worst deal from reputable places is more common
Hahahaha I never buy from reputable shops. The cars they sell I can do a engine n gearbox overhaul n still cheaper when I buy from other dealer
